title: "Discoverer" table television
text: After Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin's 1969 moon landing, with manned space exploration a reality, a giddy optimism spread throughout the United States and beyond. Industrial designers responded with futuristic forms and space-related themes that permeated home furnishings, in particular small appliances, that continued through the era of "Star Wars." Small futuristic televisions were introduced by Japanese manufactureres in the 1970s, but were not as commanding as the tabletop "Discoverer" model introduced a number of years later, with its space helmet shape and brightly colored accents.
description: rounded body with a flip-top \"visor\"; entire unit resembles a helmet; black with red; wheels on back
creditline: Gift of funds from various donors, by exchange
